page.title: 06CATFIELD AND SUTTON BY PASS
page.content: The only major road in this block is the A149 which by passes the villages of Catfield and Sutton. The road is built on the course of the old Midland and Great Northern Joint Railway which closed in 1959. The road was built about fifteen years ago. There are many clues that tell us that this was once a railway. In Catfield there is an old station house, and to the south there is a weather-boarded crossing keeper's bungalow. The road itself is flat and straight. It is a very good road but some people drive along it too fast. There have been several accidents on this stretch and some parents do not allow their children to cycle along it. There is however, no doubt that this road has eased the burden of heavy traffic in the village centres.
